title: CPR
steps: Check for responsiveness.
Call emergency services (Dial 112).
Place the person on their back.
Start chest compressions: 100–120 per minute.
Give rescue breaths (if trained): 2 breaths after every 30 compressions.
Continue until help arrives or the person starts breathing.

title: Choking
steps: Ask the person if they’re choking.
Encourage them to cough.
Give 5 back blows between shoulder blades.
If not effective, give 5 abdominal thrusts.
Repeat until object is expelled or help arrives.
Call emergency services if needed.

title: Bleeding
steps: Wear gloves if available.
Apply direct pressure to wound.
Use a clean cloth or bandage.
Keep the injured area elevated.
Do not remove embedded objects.
Call emergency services if severe.

title: Burns
steps: Remove the person from the heat source.
Cool the burn under running water for 10+ minutes.
Remove tight clothing/jewelry around the area.
Cover with a clean, non-stick dressing.
Do not pop blisters or apply creams.
Seek medical help if serious.

title: Fractures
steps: Immobilize the injured area.
Apply a splint if trained.
Avoid moving the broken bone.
Apply cold pack to reduce swelling.
Keep the person calm and still.
Call emergency services.

title: Snake Bite
steps: Keep the person calm and still.
Do not suck out venom or cut the bite.
Keep the bitten area below heart level.
Do not give anything to eat or drink.
Apply a pressure bandage (not a tourniquet).
Call emergency services immediately.

title: Heart Attack
steps: Call emergency services immediately.
Make the person sit down and stay calm.
Loosen tight clothing.
Give aspirin if available and not allergic.
Monitor breathing and pulse.
Begin CPR if the person becomes unconscious and stops breathing.

title: Stroke
steps: Use the FAST test: Face, Arms, Speech, Time.
Call emergency services immediately.
Do not give food or drink.
Keep the person calm and lying down.

title: Electric Shock
steps: Turn off the source of electricity.
Do not touch the person if they're still in contact.
Call emergency services.
Check for breathing and perform CPR if needed.

title: Drowning
steps: Remove the person from water if safe to do so.
Call emergency services.
Check for breathing and pulse.
Begin CPR if needed.

title: Seizures
steps: Clear the area of hazards.
Do not restrain the person.
Place them on their side after the seizure.
Call emergency services if it lasts more than 5 minutes.

title: Poisoning
steps: Try to identify the poison.
Do not induce vomiting unless told to.
Call emergency services or poison control.
Keep the person still and calm.
